metadata.title: CVE-2021-39698 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In aio_poll_complete_work of aio.c, there is a possible memory corruptiondue to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilegewith no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-185125206References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39698` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-169-generic - 4.15.0-169.177~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-169-generic - 4.15.0-169.177~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-169-lowlatency - 4.15.0-169.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1120-aws - 4.15.0-1120.128~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-azure - 4.15.0-1131.144~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1116-gcp - 4.15.0-1116.130~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1087-oracle - 4.15.0-1087.95~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-169.177~16.04.1').
